definition: to do a favor to sb

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
to seek contact with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to do sb a favor at little cost
to try to gain sb's friendship
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to show deference to sb by obliging them (or by obliging sb associated with them)
to try to form friendly ties with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to give a present
to take the credit for sb's achievement
one who is not prepared to risk his child will never catch the wolf (proverb)/(fig.) one who is unwilling to take risks will not achieve great things
pinyin: she3 bu4 de5 hai2 zi5 tao4 bu4 zhu4 lang2

definition: to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
intimate/private saving of family members
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
to show off one's accomplishments (often derog.)
sb with whom one is on familiar terms/sb from the same place (same house, same town etc)/one of us
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
to get undeserved rewards (idiom)
